Attilla/Luzbel:

Atilla and Luzbel shot against Ignatius 25 times (25 x bot) while 
Kali avoided the shots and continued firing agaisnt him (25 times)

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> The sand dne he hid behind was quickly being blown away by 
weaponsfire.
> Ignatius stayed low trying to avoid being hit. a blast hit near him
> exploding sending the lone Trainer sliding across the sand. He 
rolled to his
> feet fireing two missles at Shivah from the first and tird claw of 
his left
> talon. His right talon fired 25 shots of energy at Kali .
> 
> Mech fluid was slowly seeping from his frame where a combination of 
weapons
> had penetrated. He had to think of a way out. A sudden surge and a 
voice
> came through his head. "Head northeast, theres a sinkhole near the 
old
> Predacon base. You can hide in there." Ignatius thought he was 
going insane
> hearing voices. He decided to sort his sanity out later. Quickly 
the bot
> leapt into the air transforming to his eagle form and flying in the
> direction the voice had told him to go.
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: <airly2000@y...>
> To: <nbwrpg@y...>
> Sent: Saturday, June 23, 2001 11:18 PM
> Subject: Re: Kill the Trainers
> 
> 
> > Luzbel/Kali/Attila::
> >
> > Luzbel shouted "Brother and sister... it's time to shot!!!!"
> >
> >
> > Luzbel and Attila shot against Slayer (25 x bot) while Kali shot 
25
> > times against Ignatius
> >
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > > Ignatius dives toward the ground avoiding the optic blasts. The
> > projectiles
> > > from the machine guns seemed to follow him. The eaglebots body,
> > battered and
> > > beaten on throughout the battle was denting and beginning to 
crack.
> > He
> > > landed behind a sand dune hopeing that the cover would be 
enough to
> > protect
> > > him. He stuck his head and left arm up fireing a missle towards
> > Drillbit. At
> > > this point he was trying to save some amunition since there were
> > logically
> > > more than one Predacon left to battle against.

Machine

> > Ignatius'
